reviews.text: Stayed here for just one night in August 2013 in the beautiful Dingle Peninsula.
reviews.title: Pretty Good Accomodation

reviews.text: I would give it an overall rating a little above average. The house and furnishings were quite dated, but clean. The couple were more than helpful and friendly and that's what brings this otherwise pretty average B&B up.
reviews.title: Perfect location. Lovely hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At €70 it was fair value for what you got.
reviews.title: Great Spot with lovely hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bottom line. unremarkable but as good as you'll get in the area. Not ideal for a small child, which is what we had.
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.text: Myself and my 6 yr old daughter stayed for four nights at the end of Aug 2013 and had a wonderful stay. The hosts are exceptionally lovely people who went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The rooms are kept immaculately clean and are very comfortable as is the rest of the house. There is large selection of breakfasts which suited both of us (my daughter is a very picky eater). The hosts were full of local knowledge and made some great recommendations on where to go. Things to do nearby: Longs horse-riding, Ventry beach, Brandon boat hire, http://www.marinetours.ie/, Conor Pass, Slea Head drive, Blasket Island tour, aquarium, seal sanctuary. Eating out: we enjoyed The Blue Zone and An Canteen. House provides Wifi also.
reviews.title: Interesting and Enjoyable!
